keyword: how many calories are in a leg of chicken
title: How Many Calories Are in a Leg of Chicken?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a leg of chicken, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Leg of Chicken?
assumptions: Bone-in chicken leg (drumstick + thigh), skin-on, roasted without added oil or sauce; approx. 130 g edible meat.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by chicken size, cooking method, skin removal, and seasonings. Check labels or use a scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: One roasted chicken leg with skin provides about 250 kcal and 25 g protein.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a leg of chicken with skin?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for one roasted, bone-in leg with skin.

faqs.q: What if I remove the skin from a chicken leg?
faqs.a: Skinless reduces it to about 170 kcal, cutting fat significantly.

faqs.q: How much protein is in a chicken leg?
faqs.a: Around 25 g per roasted leg, making it a solid protein source.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in chicken leg?
faqs.a: Yes—roasting is lower; frying or saucing adds 40–50 kcal or more.

faqs.q: Are carbs present in a leg of chicken?
faqs.a: Negligible carbs (0 g) unless breaded or sauced; it's mostly protein and fat.
